availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Walter S. Thompson (Trigg County, Kentucky, resident.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of James E. Thompson and Ann Elizabeth Burbridge Thompson. Resident of Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twenty-eight enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Household owned Susan [Unknown], Mariah [Unknown], Catharine [Unknown], and Mary [Unknown] in Trigg County in 1852. Attended school in Trigg County in 1860. Household owned twenty-two enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, pp. 292B-293A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 189.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 391B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 53B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994056, Trigg County Births.
"Walter S. Thompson (1844-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial 34151276, accessed April 18, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/34151276.
